answer: The liquidity terms for the GBP Income Fund require a 3-month notice for withdrawals. This means that if you wish to access your funds, you need to notify the fund at least three months in advance before you can make a withdrawal. This structure indicates that the fund has a fixed lock-in period for liquidity, allowing for planned management of funds. For more detailed information, you may want to refer to the deal documents or FAQs.

This allows investors to potentially earn tax-free returns on their investments, subject to the regulations governing IF-ISAs. For more specific details on how this applies to the GBP Income Fund, you may want to check the deal documents or the IF-ISA FAQ.
